result.execSummary:
Patrick C. Sparhawk was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Patrick C. Sparhawk was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick C. Sparhawk

2:17 p.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde for ADA Cody Marschall; Defendant appears in person, in custody from the MCJ, with Attorney Michael Hughes.

Date and time set for an Extradition Hearing.

ADA Runde makes statement - Governor's Warrant has been filed.
COURT makes statement. 
Atty Hughes is ready to address the warrant, not going to contest the warrant. Does not waive extradition.
COURT addresses Defendant.
Defendant makes statement.
Atty Hughes requests ruling by the Court.
COURT makes findings - Extradition is appropriate. 

ADJ: 2:27 p.m.

2:09 p.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck for ADA Cody Marschall; Defendant appears in person, in custody from the MCJ, Attorney Michael Hughes does not appear.

Date and time set for an Extradition Hearing. 
ADA Runde makes statement - Attorney Hughes was not notified of today's hearing.
COURT makes statement.  Has received the governor's warrant. 
COURT notes Attorney Hughes was not provided notice of today's hearing.
JA in Branch 6 will contact Attorney Hughes. 

Extradition Hearing - 9/23/22 at 2:00 p.m.

ADJ: 2:12 p.m.
Governor's Warrant with Extradition Packet on Patrick Charles Sparhawk, a/k/a Patrick Sparhawk
Extradition hearing on October 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 9:41 am.
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney Michael Hughes. 
VRCW. 

Defense has reviewed Competency Examination and wish to wait for Governor's Warrant. 
Court receives. Defendant states he is competent. 
Court makes findings; Time Limits are tolled. 
State is requesting 60 days. No objections. 

Hearing to be set within the next 60 days. 
Next date to be set with JA. 

Adj: 9:43 am.
Examining psychologist's report- Jenna Goebel, PsyD

Attorney Hughes to provide an Order. 
Hearing needed between 15-20 days.
